post.body: @matthewlevine for real-world heroism.
That's exactly what @natbat was like when I pressed her for details.
Oi! I resemble that remark!
@lachlanhardy http://waxy.org/2008/03/abort_retry_or/ #courtesy #judgement
use.
But whereas Smarty is a templating language for PHP, Haml is a templating language for HTML. HTML doesn't need a templating language.
I am shocked you're even asking about Haml. Nasty, nasty stuff. Why do you want another layer of abstraction?
I believe there are drawbacks to the IE7 script. In my, albeit limited, experience, it doesn't work quite as advertised. YMMV.
'twould have been an uglier, inelegant equation without your help. Much appreciated.
I believe that comments are moderated. So be sure to say nice things about @drewm to get your comment published.
Bouzouki.
You and me both. I'm jumping ship from those traffic-shaping bastards.
Excellent! See you there.
Thank you very much (and thanks for catching the typo—now corrected).
@matthewpennell for the Spotify invitation (remember kids; "invite" is a verb).
Yes, please. jeremy@adactio.com
Being smart doesn't require faith. Quite the opposite. "Religion is a culture of faith; science is a culture of doubt." — Feynman
It is impossible for a creationist to be a smart guy.
I'll give you a one-word definition: "online".
Oh sure, let's all start sharing invitings.
Apparently you're already on there (that's what it says when I try to send you an invitation).
You and me both.
No. Fucking. Way! That's... I mean... Wha..?!!? WHAT A BUNCH OF FUCKWITS!
Thank you very much.
Absolutely loving the @24ways article by @hicksdesign. Empowerment through CSS: http://24ways.org/2008/user-styling
Wondering if @meyerweb and @malarkey are trying to outsnark each other.
Wondering what format Pownce will use to give me my data. They are going to give me my data ...right?
Receiving some bad (IMHO) news from the Powncers.
Ooh! Lookie! I'm on the Flickr blog: http://blog.flickr.net/ I think that might actually be cooler than the whole Iron Man thing.
Someone tell @simonw that the 1971 film Zeppelin is on TV right now. http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0068014/
Sending off my @24ways article to @drewm.
Back from a nice afternoon out with @clagnut and @textism. And when I say "out", I mean "in a pub."
Preparing to enter the secret cinema. Tonight a certain Ivan Reitman commedy is on the bill.
Leaning towards IDNet (thanks @benspencer and @philmatthews) ...and not just because their site validates, is accessible and uses hCard. ;-)
Thanking everyone for the ISP recommendations.
Wondering if there actually is such a thing as a good ISP in the UK.
Having an incredibly frustrating day dealing with infrastructure issues (broadband, banking and taxes) instead of doing anything useful.
On hold with my ISP (Eclipse) trying to find out if they've introduced some kind of packet shaping.
Attempting to Get Things Done from home but failing due to unresponsive interfaces. Suspecting my internet connection may be screwy.
Heading home after a day of epic procrastination.
Heading to E-Kagen.
First Pownce, now Ficlets. I should never have doubted Steven Pemberton http://adactio.com/journal/1468/
Revoking Pownce's access to my Fire Eagle account.
Enjoyed a nice cup of tea and a chat with @gezlemon and @niqui today.
Really happy that Amazon UK is now selling MP3s. Bye, bye, DRM.
Searching for wurst.
Getting back into the habit of using Tumblr rather than Pownce to link to fun/interesting videos.
Going to Unithai for a late lunch.
Changing my bouzouki strings.
Back from a fun coworking-warming at @theskiff followed by In Vino Veritas food and wine.
Going for a beer at the Skiff or The Foundry, whichever lets us in.
Stupid auto-correct. I was reading out loud in the *office* not in the face.
Reading @Zeldman's top 20 list out loud in the face. It's funny but, like a metal band watching Spinal Tap, we're relating a bit too much.
Doing the same as @snookca.
Watching @wordridden induce epilepsy through danmaku.
Fame at last! I'm on 24 Ways: http://24ways.org/2008/the-ie6-equation
Learning a song. Brian Eno is right. http://huffduffer.com/adactio/1242
Backing up.
Listening to lots of new music courtesy of my fellow Powncers. http://beta.powncebownce.com/musictilldie/ I'm going to miss 'em.
Going into town.
Back from playing a good rockin' Salter Cane gig. Thanks to everyone who came out. I'll pass on the post-gig clubbing in Legends, thanks.
Off to the Albert I go.
People of Brighton: come to the Prince Albert this evening and allow Salter Cane to rock your world ...in a miserabilist kind of way.
Changing into my concert suit.
Up at an ungodly hour.
Going to that London tomorrow to meet @preoccupations in the morning. Anyone fancy meeting up in the afternoon? http://adactio.com/contact/
Congratulating @giagia and Brian Cox. That is going to be one smart baby.
Changing my name to Jeremy Keither to make life easier for Eric Mey.
Multiplayer mobile phone lightsabre fighting ...this £5 App event just gets better and better.
PeoplePong and robots ...this is an epic £5App.
Learning all about Spaceship at a very festive £5 App. http://textadventure.org.uk/
Heading out to the £5 App where I can rant with my fellow Brightonian geeks about Yahoo fuckwitism instead of just fuming to myself.
Yahoo are bunch of fucking twunts. What kind of dribbling moronic company lays off someone like @BenWard? Fuckwits. Cockbadgers. Pisstards.
Getting my new internet connection up and running. That was easy.
Going home to debug the internet connection.
On the train back to Brighton because I can't be bothered hanging around in London 'till the Webbies thingy.
Thinking about what to build for the Last.fm hack day on Sunday.
Listening to House of Love and looking forward to @wordridden's gourmet pizza after a productive day of work with @natbat.
Going to The Dorset for nommage.
Watching @clagnut amass data to shame browser makers on their font rendering.
Wondering when people will realise that TechC*nt is no better than Valleywag.
Finished sending Spotify invitations to people who a) don't call them "invites" and b) actually provided an email address.
Refusing to share the Spotify love with people who use verbs as nouns.
Anybody want to try Spotify?
Sneaking out of the all-hands Christmas party.
Scheming with @heathr.
Heading out to the @clearleft Christmas lunch.
Watching Salter Cane rock out. http://tinyurl.com/69eadb
Flicking through my copy of Flexible Web Design by Zoe Mickey Gillenwater.
Suggesting dismantling a speaker to get the magnet to magnetise the screw to open the Mac to replace the memory. Yak-shaving par excellence.
Experimenting with column-count and column-gap.
Hoping that somebody at Technorati notices that this API method currently isn't working. http://technorati.com/developers/api/cosmos.html
Goodbye Pownce, hello linkrot.
Registering Apple Care. It expires "10/04/2011". I honestly have no idea if that means October or March. The fault lies not with me.
Using :first-child, box-shadow and RGBa. Looks great in proper browers; still looks okay in IE.
OH: I really want a pet ocelot.
Successfully catching the train to Brighton, ETA 10pm.
Getting ready to head back to Brighton (as soon as the Last.fm hackday results are announced).
Watching @ni demo his Last.fm-powered arduino-driven ambient USB device. WANT!
Just demoed my (very unambitious) hack in the allotted time of two minutes. XFN + RSS = Huffduffer * Last.fm
Loving @flaneur's Songcolours hack. http://tinyurl.com/64l8og
Back from having a great pizza with @hannah_monster at Story Deli. Now: mulled wine and hacking.
Watching @hannah_monster draw hack monsters on a Surface.
Having fun hacking but getting stumped trying to finesse my lamentable PHP.
Settling in at the Last.fm hack day.
Up early to go to London for the Last.fm hack day.
Asking "What's got two thumbs and a lovely new jumper?"
Wishing everyone a very happy Isaac Newton day. Science bless us, each and every one of us!
Waiting for the magic tablets to cure my hurty head. Probable cause: too many pints of Murphy's in the Roaring Donkey last night.
Well impressed with the 24 knockout nuggets from @24ways this year. Take a bow, @drewm, @briansuda and co.
Feeling very proud of the liquid/HTML5/CSS3 work that @natbat and I did on the @uxlondon site. http://uxlondon.com/
Knackered after a day out in Cork.
Back in my childhood home in Ireland ...doing tech support.
Going to Gatwick where I will grit my teeth to fly with Ryan Air. I hate them.
Adding sparklines to Huffduffer.
Packing for Ireland.
OH: My second cousin was in a TV programme with a psammead.
Drinking mulled cider at @clagnut's.
Wearing my party shirt. Time to hit chez @clagnut and get sozzled with the rest of the @clearleft crew.
Finished work for the day, week, month and year. Time to put on my party shirt.
Congratulating @lukewdesign. Welcome to the world, Benek.
Back home after a good day's work that even IE6 couldn't destroy.
Full of tartiflette.
Going to check out the French market over by the library.
Getting the hang of :nth-child pseudo classes.
